properties.name: Bonnie Brae Golf Club
properties.description: Posted by System This course was built on the site of an old farm. The layout is highlighted by five lakes and several creeks, which offer both a challenge and a pleasing aesthetic. The gently-rolling, generous fairways play to tight, well-undulating greens.

properties.name: Cedars/Willows Course at Carolina Springs Family Golf Center
properties.description: Posted by System  This club has three nine hole courses that are played in three eighteen hole combinations. These courses are very scenic and home to an abundance of wildlife like foxes and rabbits. The Pines Course is the most challenging of the three because of the numerous water hazards that come into play on some holes. The signature hole on this course is #3, a 447-yard, par 4, requiring a tee shot up a dogleg left fairway, then an approach shot by the lateral water hazard to the green. The Cedar Course has tight tree-lined fairways, and the Willows Course has wide-open fairways and less water hazards than the other two courses. The greens on all three courses are large, undulating, and fast. All three courses were built on rolling terrain.

properties.name: Creekside Course at Pebble Creek Country Club
properties.description: Posted by System This club offers two regulation eighteen hole courses. The Linkside Course is a traditional design featuring large and undulating greens. You won\'t come back to the clubhouse until you are finished playing the entire course. Water hazards (ponds and creeks) come into play on twelve holes. Some of the tees and greens are elevated, but you won\'t find many blind shots. The Creekside Course is shorter than the Linkside Course and considered by locals as a true target course. It will take finesse to master because length and power do not factor into the game. There are some short dogleg fairways, and water comes into play on most holes. Both courses were built on hilly terrain and are well bunkered. Metal spikes are only allowed on the Creekside Course.

properties.name: Dragon den
properties.description: Posted by Danny99

properties.name: Fox Run Country Club
properties.description: Posted by System The most unique feature about this course is its scenic location. Even though the course is located in a heavily-populated area, it is still very secluded.

properties.name: Furman University Golf Course
properties.description: Posted by System This is one of the finest University Courses in the country. The most difficult hole is #13, a 469-yard, par 4, from the championship tees. Water hazards (streams and creeks) come into play on a few holes.

properties.name: Green Valley Country Club
properties.description: Posted by System This course has water hazards coming into play on most holes. The most difficult hole is #1, a 437-yard, par 4, requiring a tee shot up a dogleg left fairway, then an approach shot over a creek to the green.

properties.name: Hejaz Shrine Recreation Club
properties.description: Posted by System This course features two large lakes coming into play on many holes. The fairways are narrow on most holes. The most difficult hole is #6, a 528-yard, par 5, requiring a series of uphill shots all the way to the green.

properties.name: Hillandale Golf Course
properties.description: Posted by System This somewhat hilly course has medium-sized greens that are undulating. Some holes on the back nine are very strenuous to walk. Water hazards come into play on a few holes.

properties.name: Southern Oaks Golf Course
properties.description: Posted by System This course\'s signature hole is #13, a 155-yard, par 3, requiring a tee shot over water to the green.

properties.name: Summersett Golf Club
properties.description: Posted by System This short eighteen hole course is located at the foot of Paris Mountain. There are many changes in elevation, which will cause uneven lies. The fairways are tight and tree lined, and the greens are small and fast. Lakes, ponds and streams come into play on nine holes. Tom Jackson redesigned this course in 1979.

properties.name: Thornblade Club
properties.description: Posted by System This private course is well maintained and said to be very beautiful. There are many trees lining the narrow fairways, and water hazards come into play on some holes. The signature hole is #1, a 439-yard, par 4, requiring both the tee and approach shots to be played over water. This club offers junior membership discount rates throughout the entire season.

properties.name: Tony's pizza
properties.description: Posted by Danny99

properties.name: Verdae Greens Golf Club
properties.description: Posted by System This club annually hosts the Nike Tour\'s Upstate Classic. The course is mostly known for its narrow fairways and hilly terrain. Water frequently comes into play, including on hole #2, a 201-yard, par 3, which requires a tee shot over water.

properties.name: Willow Creek Golf Course
properties.description: Posted by System This course has several tree-lined fairways and many brooks and streams. Water comes into play on eight holes. The signature hole is #5, a 516-yard, par 5, featuring gently rolling hills and a stream that flows through the fairway.

properties.name: Willows/Pines Course at Carolina Springs Family Golf Center
properties.description: Posted by System  This club has three nine hole courses that are played in three eighteen hole combinations. These courses are very scenic and home to an abundance of wildlife like foxes and rabbits. The Pines Course is the most challenging of the three because of the numerous water hazards that come into play on some holes. The signature hole on this course is #3, a 447-yard, par 4, requiring a tee shot up a dogleg left fairway, then an approach shot by the lateral water hazard to the green. The Cedar Course has tight tree-lined fairways, and the Willows Course has wide-open fairways and less water hazards than the other two courses. The greens on all three courses are large, undulating, and fast. All three courses were built on rolling terrain.
